intro: Pedicularis kokpakensis, commonly known as the Kokpansky lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color, and its hairy, often succulent stems. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
